title: Fitness instructor flees home and quits job after jilted ex sends 1,168 texts
text:

A fitness instructor was forced to flee her home and give up her job at a village gym after she was harassed by an obsessed ex-boyfriend who wrongly believed she had cheated on him.

Kate Brooks, 35, was left a 'broken woman' after she hounded by businessman Heath Speakman when he became fixated with false claims she had a relationship with a personal trainer known only as Tom.

Speakman, 49, who ran a carpet cleaning company, sent Miss Brookes more than 1,000 texts falsely including claiming he had cancer.

He also threatened to kill himself and even left a handwritten message on her car windscreen warning her he had been diagnosed with an STD.

(Image: Kate Brooks/ Cavendish Press (Ma)

The dad-of-two also created a fake Instagram account in the name of Tom and lifted his biographical details to hound Miss Brooks with messages.

He would also use his own social media business page to post offensive messages on Miss Brooks keep fit blog.

One including a message on an article she posted called the 'naked truth', commenting: “Wouldn’t worry, everyone has seen you naked.”

The victim, from Disley in Greater Manchester was so scared of Speakman she had to be given an escort from work by her colleagues and she moved in with a friend.

Police said he sent a total of 1,168 text messages and created nine fake email accounts to harangue Miss Brooks from June to August 2018.

At Stockport magistrates court she relived her ordeal as Speakman from St Helens, Merseyside was found guilty of harassment.

(Image: Kate Brooks/ Cavendish Press (Ma)

He failed to show for the trial and a warrant was issued for his arrest.

Miss Brooks who has since undergone counselling over her ordeal told the hearing: "At the time I was so sucked into this toxic and controlling relationship, I was completely lost and a shell of a person.

"I wasn’t safe in that relationship at all and I know that now.

"When I came out of that relationship I was completely broken. I was with my sister for six weeks, I fled the house in the final week I left him.

"I felt like I was being suffocated with all of this contact, it was incessant. I had to leave my job, I didn’t feel safe working at the gym.

(Image: Heath Speakman/ Cavendish Press)

"Then I moved in with my friend but I felt like I was constantly checking number plates and vans. He was following me around in work and I felt there was no way of getting away from him. He knew my routine and I felt my world was so small.

"This has affected everything I have ever done, everything with work, even now. As a personal trainer, I have to put myself out there in the public domain and I can’t go into hiding.

"But any time I have an enquiry for, an unknown number, there’s that fear that it’s him.

"In the back of my mind he is still watching from some sort of account. I am constantly looking over my shoulder, even now. I fear for other women as well.”

The court heard the pair had dated for three years and lived together in Disley but they split up in 2018 and Speakman began hounding her soon after that.

(Image: Kate Brooks/ Cavendish Press (Ma)

She said: "He was accusing me of cheating and lying and he was obsessively using social media.

"He was obsessed with this one person called Tom and he was fixated with him and during our whole relationship he was accusing me of cheating with him.

"The messages were erratic, they were coming from all communication channels, he was posting abusive comments and sending me emails.

"He was setting up multiple email accounts and he sent me messages saying I owed him money. There were email messages saying he had cancer and that he was going to commit suicide.

"He was suffocating me and coming from all angles, it was nonstop, multiple times a day, multiple comments over many different channels.

(Image: Heath Speakman/ Cavendish Press)

"I knew the emails were fake email accounts and I knew they would be from him. He was saying he was not going to stop this until I responded.

"He said he was going to confront me and it got to that point that the police officer I was going to, was convinced he was saying this so many times that he was going to come and confront me, so she had him arrested.

"He even committed fraud in my name. He contacted N Power as we used them at the house we previously lived at.

"He claimed that I was the tenant and he said he was the landlord and a £3,000 bill was sent to my sisters address, as I was living with my sister at the time.

"That was the final straw and I went to the police about that. I received hundreds of texts, around 50 emails, all of which I still have.

(Image: Kate Brooks/ Cavendish Press (Ma)

"They were from a lot of different accounts. He set up a fake Facebook account of someone called 'Kevin Green'. He also set up another profile of a man’s name with woman’s picture.

"I had a blog, which I’ve since deleted, called “Gym and Toneics” and he used his business page “Cleaning and Furniture” to comment on every single thing I posted.

"I posted a blog post and he wrote: “Was Tom there, did you talk about me”.

''Tom was a personal trainer I had sessions with him years ago and he was obsessed with that guy. He thought I had cheated with him. Many arguments were started about this guy.

"I even received a friend request on Instagram from “StretchTomOne” when Tom had an account called “StretchTom”, so I knew Heath had made a fake account.

(Image: Kate Brooks/ Cavendish Press (Ma)

"The police did get in touch with Tom and he confirmed it was a fake account and the defendant had mirrored his account, it was the same kind of biography and everything.

"I wrote a blog post called the naked truth and he commented: 'Wouldn’t worry, everyone has seen you naked'. My blog was just about exercising and gym.

"Every single picture I put on that account, he commented on. An account called 'Kevin Green' tried to add me then he sent me a message. He was texting me saying if I didn’t respond he would confront me.

"When we were together I worked at a gym and he had a free membership because I worked there but I can count on one hand the amount of times he went into the gym to use it. Then when I split up with him, he went all the time.

"Work were aware of what was going on. I changed my shift at the gym.

(Image: Kate Brooks/ Cavendish Press (Ma)

"I would see his car driving round the the gym and then I would see his car parked next to my car. One evening I was escorted out of work by a member of staff and he had left a letter on the windscreen on my car.

"It said: 'Kate, I’m not sure if you’ve seen my email, I think you have but I need to be sure. I have an STI, and what I have is cancer.

"You need to get a smear test...” I have never suffered with anxiety ever, not properly. I am now fully aware of what I was in, in terms of how bad this relationship was.''

Speakman was arrested in August last year.

Pc Tracy Brookes told the JPs: “He explained they were looking to move to Devon.

"Heath Speakman confirmed emailing her several times using several accounts and when asked why, he said he wanted to make sure she got the message about the STI as he was aware she had blocked him on social media.

''When asked why he continued to contact her after she blocked him, he said he didn’t know if she was getting the message.

"He said he is receiving treatment at hospital and said he knew one of the Facebook accounts but he was not responsible. He said he had a friend staying at his house and they used his phone to make the posts, but he did not name them.

"He was asked about the Facebook account Kevin Green but he said it was not him. He said he thought everyone knows about the whole situation, so it could be anyone.

"He said he told a woman about the situation and said she had apologised to him for doing it, but he didn’t name the woman. He confirmed he had been to the gym with his children.''

Magistrates found the case proved in Speakman's absence.
description: Kate Brooks, 35, was left a 'broken woman' after she hounded by businessman Heath Speakman who falsely claimed he had cancer, threatened suicide and said he had a STD
